title: Enriching the auto-generated OpenAPI-Spec
raw_output:
{'files_to_modify': ['fastapi/openapi/utils.py', 'fastapi/openapi/models.py', 'fastapi/applications.py', 'fastapi/openapi/docs.py', 'fastapi/openapi/constants.py'], 'reasoning': '1. fastapi/openapi/utils.py: Core schema assembly/generation functions for OpenAPI; enrichments to tags, x-logo, and extensions should be handled here, specifically in the code generating the top-level OpenAPI dict.
2. fastapi/openapi/models.py: Contains data models for OpenAPI objects; should be updated to include new spec features (e.g., x-logo, extra metadata) so that they can be represented in the schema.
3. fastapi/applications.py: Wires together arguments that become part of OpenAPI, exposes the schema on routes. Modifications here for extra config (custom fields/tags/logo) should be supported via arguments and passed downstream.
4. fastapi/openapi/docs.py: Responsible for serving docs (Swagger/ReDoc); needed for any enrichment involving the way docs render custom features like x-logo.
5. fastapi/openapi/constants.py: May require small updates if new constants are added for keys/extensions relevant to OpenAPI.
Other files are not directly involved in generation/enrichment of OpenAPI spec.'}
